result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua R Wittenberg

defendant.name: Wittenberg, Joshua R
defendant.address: W7415 Council Bay Road, Holmen, WI 54636

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Def w/Atty Hammer
  Statement as to Neg. Plea filed
CRT: DRI

State by Minser / Def in custody w/ Atty Russell Hammer
Hammer:  def has been in custody wince 6-28-14.  Bail is set @ $500, def can't pay - def could stay @ SA, so he'd be able to walk back & forth to JSS..
Minser feels cash is approp
CRT  Mr Minser's arguments are very good but def hasn't been convicted yet - he has constiutional right to be monitored w/o incarceratin - what are status of cases?
Hammer:  PTC is not until 12th - I submitted proposal to Ms. Hynek & she rejected the sentencing request
CRT:  I would prefer to have a PSI conducted while Def is in the community to see if he's amendable - 
Hammer:  are you able to schedule a plea from the bench?
CRT:  Plea Hrg: 9-2-14 @ 3 pm w/ RAG (20 min)

11 am     Def in court w/ Atty Russell Edward Hammer.  Def in custody.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Settlement discussions.  Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No threats/force.
COURT is satisfied that the waiver of the PH is F, I & V made.   Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Pleads NG  - NG Pleas entered.

PTC:  8/22 at 3:30 pm     STC:  10/23 at 10 am   RAG

Hammer asks for sig. bond w/JS monitoring.  JS says the can monitor him at the Salvation Army.  Hynek:  He's a 9 out of 10 on the pre-trial release.  He cut off his bracelet and was arrested for BJ.  He's shown he can't comply with anything.  I think the cash is appropriate.
COURT comments.  JS to come interview him again to see whether he would be amenable in the community.  The bond will remain.

From: JSS Re: JSS does not have any equipment that can be cut off
RAG: noted

Hammer requests Sig Bond
CRT: Will consider a modification  of bond if JS can determine how to monitor him.
Cash Bond Remains
PH: 07-31-14 at 11:00am w/RAG

Not sure if we have an attorney yet
CRT: Remove from PH calendar on 07-17-14
CC: 07-23-14 at 1:30pm w/RAG
Per DTP hearing in 14CF431 - move 14CF441 PH to 7/7/14 @ 11 am

Def w/Atty Sanford
$1000 cash bond required
PH: 7/14 @ 11 (DTP)
